q:
Which of the following statements is correct about the given CSS3 code:

Code

a:link , a:visited { 

background-color: blue;

}

a:hover {

background-color: yellow;

}

<a href = "test.html"> Hi </a>

Options

  1. It creates a button having the background color blue.
  2. It creates a link having the background color blue and on hover, the background color will be yellow.
  3. It creates a link having the background color yellow.
  4. It creates a button having the background color blue and on hover, the color will change to yellow.

What will be the color of the text "Hello" in the following HTML5 code?

Code:

<html>
<head>
<style>
 ul#decoration #list {
    color: green;
 }
 .like span {
    color: yellow!important;
 }
</style>
</head>

<body>

<ol class="greet" id="decoration">
    <li>Hi</li>
    <li class="like" id="list"><span class="hello">Hello</span></li>
</ol>

</body>
</html>

What will be the color of the text "Noice" in the following HTML5 code?

Code:

<html>
<head>
<style>
 ol.greet li .hello {
    color: brown;
  }
  ol.greet li .hello:nth-of-type(odd) {
    color: black;
  }
</style>
</head>
<body>
<ol class="greet" id="decoration">
    <li>Hi</li>
    <li class="like" id="list"><span class="hello">Noice</span></li>
</ol>
</body>
</html

What will be the output of the following HTML5 code?
 

Code

<!DOCTYPE html5>
<html>
   <head></head>
   <body>
      <table border=2>
         <tbody>
            <tr>
               <th colspan="4">Greet</th>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               
               <td rowspan="2">hackerearth</td>
               <td colspan="1" rowspan="1">hi</td>
               <td colspan="2">noice</td>
            </tr>
            
            <tr>
               <td colspan="3">good-bye</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               <td colspan="1" rowspan="2">Hackerearth</td>
               <td colspan="3">good night</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               <td colspan="2">good</td>
               <td colspan="1" rowspan="2">byee</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               
               <td rowspan="2">hack</td>
               <td colspan="2" rowspan="1">hello world</td>
            </tr>
         </tbody>
      </table>
   </body>
</html>


Output




  1.  


  2.  


  3.  


  4.

What will be the output of the following HTML5 code?

Code

<!DOCTYPE html5>
<html>
   <head></head>
   <body>
      <table border=2>
         <tbody>
            <tr>
               <th colspan="4">Greet</th>
            </tr>

               <td rowspan="2">hackerearth</td>
               <td colspan="1" rowspan="1">hi</td>
               <td colspan="2">noice</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               <td colspan="3">good-bye</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               <td colspan="1" rowspan="2">Hackerearth</td>
               <td colspan="3">good night</td>

            <tr>
               <td colspan="2">good</td>
               <td colspan="1">byee</td>
            </tr>
         </tbody>
      </table>

</html>


 

Output




  1.  



  2.

What will be the output of the following HTML5 code?
 

Code

<!DOCTYPE html5>
<html>
   <head></head>
   <body>
      <table border=2>
         <tbody>
            <tr>
               <th colspan="4">Greet</th>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               <td colspan="1" rowspan="2">hi</td>
               <td rowspan="2">hello</td>
               <td colspan="2">hey</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               <td colspan="2">how</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
               <td colspan="2">hackerearth</td>
               <td colspan="2">you</td>
            </tr>
         </tbody>
      </table>
   </body>
</html>

 

Output




  1.  
  2.

In HTML5, you are working on semantic elements. Which of the following statements about the element are correct:
    1. This element is used to define the hidden and the marquee heading with the content that is displayed in the
element.
    2. User clicks on the heading are created by using the element to show the content of a website.
    3. The element should be the first child of the
element whose content must be displayed.

a.option: <summary> is not a semantic element in HTML5.

q:
In HTML5, you are working on Web Forms 2.0. Which of the following statements about attributes in the output tag are correct:
    1. The for attribute is used to determine the relationship between the result of the operation and the elements that is used in the operation.
    2. The form attribute is used to determine the form to which the output tag is redirected.
    3. The name attribute is used to determine the name of the output element.

In HTML5, you are working on multimedia attributes. Which of the following statements about the format of the Ogg file are correct:
    1. Every page of data begins with characters ‘OggC’ to identify the file as the Ogg format.
    2. The page number in the page header identifies each page as a part of a series of pages that are creating a bitstream sequence. The sequence number is used to identify the sequence of the video or the audio format that is embedded in the source file.
    3. Multiple bitstream sequences are combined as a single bitstream sequence in the file where pages from each bitstream are arranged by the seek time of the contained data.
    4. Bitstreams are appended to existing files so that the bitstreams can be decoded sequentially.

In HTML5, you are working on multimedia attributes. You have requested a media response to your web server. The web server sends an HTTP response that indicates an error that can occur while configuring this request. If you are required to configure the server for the media type so that you can add the Ogg video format files, then which of the following configuration syntax must be used to perform this task?

In HTML5, you are working on Web Forms 2.0. You have included the ‘range’ value in the type attribute of the input tag. If you are given the minimum and the maximum values of the Slider control, then which of the following statements about the default value of this control are correct:
    1. If the minimum value is 2 and the maximum value is 100, then the default value is 52.
    2. If the minimum value is 50 and the maximum value is 1000, then the default value is 525.
    3. If the minimum value is -2 and the maximum value is -10, then the default value is -2.
    4. If the minimum value is -4 and the maximum value is 20, then the default value is 20.

In HTML5, you are working on semantic elements. If you are required to display image hackhtml.jpg when you press the Enter key from your keyboard by using the <figure> tag, then which of the following keyboard event attributes must be used to perform this task?

In HTML5, if you are working on semantic elements, then which of the following statements about the
element are correct:
    1. This element is used to render all the non-semantic elements of a particular script in the browser.
    2. This element is used to define the content that is hidden from the original content of a script.

In HTML5, you are working on multimedia attributes. If you are playing a video ‘hackhtml5.mp4” of a path “/hackerearth/html5/multimedia/hackhtml5.mp4’, then which of the following JavaScript events is generated when the playback speed of the video is increased by three times the original playback speed?

In HTML5, you are working on multimedia attributes. If you are required to identify the media source file in your HTML5 script, then which of the following attributes must be used to perform this task?
In HTML5, you are working on semantic elements. Which of the following semantic elements is used to define the additional information of the user interface that a user can view?
In HTML5, you are working on Web Forms 2.0. If you have included a ‘number’ value in the type attribute of the input tag, then determine the default value of the step attribute in this scenario?

a.option: Default values cannot be included in the type attribute

q: In HTML5, you are working on Web Forms 2.0. You have included the ‘email’ value in the type attribute of the input tag. If your element represents the input control for which a User Agent is required to store the value that is entered by a user, then which of the following attributes is used to perform this task?

What is the output of the following HTML code:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <body>
        <h1>Hello HackerEarth!</h1>
        <table>
            <tr>
                <th>Name</th>
                <th>Country code</th>
                <th>Country name</th>
            </tr>
            <tr>
                <td>Alice</td>
                <td>CN02</td>
                <td>India</td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
                <td>Bob, Tara</td>
                <td>CN05</td>
                <td>USA</td>
            </tr>
        </table>
    </body>
</html>

1.

2.

3.

a.option: Displays only “Hello HackerEarth!” as there are syntax errors in the table.
